page.title: 19BIOGRAPHY
page.content: Colonel Sholto Douglas Colonel Douglas started his career in 1932.Following in his father's footsteps,he served in various places. When World War 2 broke out he was aged,28.He was stationed in Southern India,Bombay,Punjab and Waziristan in the North.He served the whole war in the Indian army.The food he ate was chicken,rice,fish,bread and jam,and he suffered from a stomach complaint from 1939 to 1943.Standard issue clothes where bush shirt,shorts and hog skins. Transport was generally motor bikes or camels.Weapons where Vickers machine gun,Browning .45 pistol,Biretta.He was awarded the Indian General Service Medal and the General Service War Medal.
